metadata.Title: CVE-2021-30549 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use after free in Spell check in Google Chrome prior to 91.0.4472.101 allowed an attacker who convinced a user to install a malicious extension to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-30549` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 91.0.4472.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 91.0.4472.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 91.0.4472.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 91.0.4472.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 91.0.4472.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 19.10, the chromium-browser package is just a script that installs the Chromium snap

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '91.0.4472.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
